title: 114_hr1815
content: The Act titled "Eastern Nevada Land Implementation Improvement Act" facilitates pinyon-juniper related projects in Lincoln County, Nevada. The Eastern Nevada Land Implementation Improvement Act amends the Lincoln County Land Act of 2000 to facilitate the development and implementation of comprehensive, cost-effective pinyon-juniper related projects. The Eastern Nevada Land Implementation Improvement Act aims to facilitate hazardous fuels reduction projects and wildfire prevention planning activities, particularly for pinyon-juniper dominated landscapes, within the County. It also requires cooperative agreements between the Bureau of Land Management and the County for approved law enforcement and planning related activities. The Secretary approved planning activities related to wilderness, cultural resources, the Silver State OHV Trail, and land disposal in Lincoln County as per the Lincoln County Conservation, Recreation, and Development Act of 2004. The Lincoln County Conservation, Recreation, and Development Act of 2004 is amended to include the development and implementation of hazardous fuels reduction and wildfire prevention planning activities. The Lincoln County Conservation, Recreation, and Development Act of 2004 is amended to include cooperative agreements between the Bureau of Land Management and the County for law enforcement and planning activities related to wilderness areas, cultural resources, and the Silver State OHV Trail. The Lincoln County Land Act of 2000 and the Lincoln County Regional Development Authority are amended for land disposal planning and utility corridors. Proceeds under the Lincoln County Land Act of 2000 are also amended to include the Lincoln County Regional Development Authority. The Lincoln County Conservation, Recreation, and Development Act of 2004 is amended to include the Lincoln County Regional Development Authority in transportation planning. A portion of the utility corridor established in 2004 will be realigned by the Secretary of the Interior. The Lincoln County Conservation, Recreation, and Development Act of 2004 is amended to include the Lincoln County Regional Development Authority in transportation planning. A utility corridor established in 2004 will be realigned in Clark County, Nevada, to benefit the desert tortoise and other species. Patent number 27-2005-0081 issued by the Bureau of Land Management is affirmed and validated for the recovery of the desert tortoise habitat. The Lincoln County Conservation, Recreation, and Development Act of 2004 is amended to include the Lincoln County Regional Development Authority in transportation planning. Ratification of reconfiguration for land described in the Final Environmental Impact Statement is affirmed for the recovery of the desert tortoise habitat in Lincoln County, Nevada. The Secretary of the Interior may issue a corrective patent for 7,548 acres of land in Lincoln County, Nevada, in compliance with the Nevada-Florida Land Exchange Authorization Act of 1988. SEC. 3. Boundary adjustments for Mt. Moriah Wilderness, High Schells Wilderness, and Arc Dome Wilderness. Amendments to the Pam White Wilderness Act include adjustments to the boundaries of the Mt. Moriah Wilderness and High Schells Wilderness. The boundaries of the High Schells Wilderness are adjusted to include specific land and exclude other land, as outlined in the Nevada Wilderness Protection Act of 1989. The Arc Dome Wilderness boundary is adjusted to exclude certain land, a conservation plan for the Virgin River in Nevada is implemented, and a technical amendment is made to Public Law 99-548.
